title: Frost on the fells
caption: Frost on the fells
desc: This wintry Lake District landscape is covered in hoar frost, which derives its name from the old English word for white hair, which the glittering ice crystals are thought to resemble. When water vapour in the air hits surfaces which are below freezing point, ice crystals form instantly, growing into feathery, hair-like structures as more water vapour freezes.
